name: nytimes
text: Evening Briefing: Here's what you need to know at the end of the day https://t.co/80Qt6vJJkU

name: nytimes
text: Senator Lisa Murkowski, Republican of Alaska, said that she endorsed scathing criticism of President Trump’s leadership by Jim Mattis, the former secretary of defense, and was grappling with whether to support the president in the coming election https://t.co/RzUFmuwf5d

name: nytimes
text: The New York Times acknowledged that an Op-Ed by Sen. Tom Cotton fell short of its standards and that the editing process was “rushed." The statement came after A. G. Sulzberger, the publisher, and James Bennet, the opinion editor, had defended the essay. https://t.co/jSvaU7fQBb

name: nytimes
text:
RT @cliffordlevy: NEW YORK CITY!
https://t.co/le7Gv9vP8k https://t.co/sb7FakXogr

name: nytimes
text:
RT @migold: We have @NYTMetro reporters seeing dozens of arrests of protesters with no provocation, for the second night in a row.

We have reports of officers charging at protesters with batons, hours after the governor said "they don't do that." https://t.co/uPrPZn6ZgM

name: nytimes
text: A 23-year-old art teacher was thrilled to see his city at the fore of a nationwide event. “I’m proud to call myself a New Yorker,” he said. “This is everyone’s city.” https://t.co/5yQVE6sJsI

name: nytimes
text:
Watch as New York City police officers began arresting protesters in Manhattan about 30 minutes after the city’s 8 p.m. curfew began Thursday.

Elsewhere, police surrounded a group of protesters in the Bronx, then charged at them. Read the latest. https://t.co/qdvQMsy8xa https://t.co/98mmvVACJe

name: nytimes
text: Correction: An earlier tweet incorrectly referred to DVDs as a tool the CDC uses to back up information. Though the agency is in the midst of an effort to modernize its network and move to cloud computing, it does not use DVDs as a storage system. https://t.co/wm9sVjjmlz

name: nytimes
text:
RT @carolrosenberg: Big News: A military judge ruled today that war court judges have the power to reduce the prison sentence of a Qaeda operative at Guantánamo Bay, as a remedy for torture by the CIA. 
Whether to do it, is to be decided at sentencing.  Story, ruling. https://t.co/ACnj7VFuJ0
